title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Friday, 18 December 2015. - BBC News
summary: councils in beds , herts and bucks are digesting details of the government 's new funding agreement .
a former countdown champion from bedford who travelled 400 miles to attack a teenager who gave his book a bad review is jailed .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us for this week .
join us again on monday from 08:00 for the latest news , sport , weather and travel for beds , herts and bucks .

documents.title: weather watchers : christmas lights in toddington
text: we think it 's close enough to christmas now to share some of the more festiveweather watchersphotos .
this one shows the christmas lights on trees in toddington village green .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: weather : some patchy rain overnight
text: tonight : a few clear intervals but mainly cloudy .
becoming misty with some patchy light rain .
temperatures climb from 11c ( 52f ) this evening to 14c ( 57f ) by dawn .
tomorrow : a cloudy and murky to start but staying mainly dry with the cloud thinning and breaking to give some brighter spells .
temperatures reaching 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: new contracts for treating waste in bucks
text: bucks county council has given out four contracts to treat the county 's food and garden waste over the next two years .
author: Get Bucks

documents.title: bedford council cuts 'a devastating blow '
text: the mayor of bedford has called the government 's cuts in the area `` a devastating blow '' .
bedford borough council will lose 29 % of its main grant , according to the announcement yesterday , which means more than £ 3m will be cut from the budget .
`` we were already forecasting massive cuts which would make the reduction or loss of services unavoidable , but this is even worse , '' mayor dave hodgson said .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cul-de-sac lights up for christmas
text: this is summerhayes in great linford , milton keynes .
most of the houses in this cul-de-sac are decked out like this .
the residents do it all in aid of willen hos and have raised £ 37,000 since 2004 .
author: Toby Friedner
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: butterfly world closure : the sanctuary from the sky
text: almost a week ago it emerged that butterfly world in st albans would have to close due to what its chairman said were financial difficulties .
st albans-based company , skyphocal , says it has been following the story after it had the chance to film the sanctuary in september .
`` [ we did n't realise ] that we were recording its final days ''
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : herts man interviewed on shoreham air crash bedford author jailed
text: the top stories :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : m25 closed a1m blocked thameslink trains delayed
text: the m25 clockwise remains closed at j20-j21 due to a shed load of food waste .
a diversion via the a41 and a405 is in place .
congestion to j17 .
the a1m northbound is partially blocked j5-j6 due to a collision .
thameslink trains are delayed by up to 15 minutes on the bedford to brighton line due to overhead line problems .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: police terror video advises public to 'run , hide , tell '
text: police have released a videotelling people to `` run , hide , tell '' if they are caught up in a terrorist gun attack .
the four-minute video advises on how to evacuate a building , where to hide , and what information to tell police .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: nicola cross murder inquiry : case adjourned until march
text: the case of a man accused of murdering a woman in hemel hempstead and then trying to kidnap her two young children has been adjourned in court today .
marcin porczynski , 23 , is accused of stabbing nicola cross , 37 , at her home in dunlin road three months ago .
there will be a hearing on 7 march to see if he is fit to stand trial .

documents.title: luton can apply for extra funding to help homeless
text: luton borough council has been named among 25 local authorities that can apply for extra funding to help house the homeless .
luton is only one of three councils outside london than can apply for £ 200,000 from the £ 1m fund .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon headlines : murder accused in court m25 closed in hertfordshire
text: the stories we 're looking at :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: shoreham air crash : hertfordshire man interviewed
text: a hertfordshire man has been interviewed by police in connection with the shoreham air crash in west sussex in august .
police say the man voluntarily attended an appointment in which he was interviewed under caution but not arrested .
eleven men died as a result of the vintage hunter jet crashing into the a427 .
pilot andy hill , 51 , from sandon , near buntingford , hertfordshire , was in a critical condition after the crash but was discharged from hospital in september .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: firefighters release boy stuck in plastic hoop
text: a boy who got stuck in a plastic hoop in a buckinghamshire playground has been released by firefighters .
a crew attended the playground in fennels road , high wycombe at 10:45 .
the boy was n't injured .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two die in roxton marina site caravan fire : at the scene
text: two people died in a caravan fire near a marina in the early hours of the morning .

firefighters were called to a boatyard at kelpie marina , great north road , roxton , bedfordshire , at 01:00 gmt , where three crews dealt with the blaze and made safe two gas cylinders at the site .
the fire service and police have started an investigation into the cause .

documents.title: 3cr live from aylesbury panto
text: i 'm broadcasting my programme live from theaylesbury waterside theatrethis afternoon .
we 'll be backstage with exclusive access , chatting to the stars and the people who make it all work.join mefrom 15:00 .
author: Roberto Perrone
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: war memorabilia stolen from sandy home
text: war memorabilia has been stolen from a home in sandy during a burglary .
items of great sentimental value were stolen in the burglary at a property in fieldfare , including military medals , cap badges and a ring set with five sapphires in the shape of a flower .
the incident took place between 19:30 and 20:00 on 10 december .

documents.title: getting into the festive spirit at bbc 3cr
text: a few of us have got into the festive spirit today as there is just one week left until christmas
the annual dusting-off of festive jumpers has happened - do n't we all look very happy about it too !
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stevenage flat fire leaves person in hospital
text: one person has been taken to hospital after a flat fire in stevenage this morning .
fire crews were called to the blaze in prestatyn close .

documents.title: luton town seek new manager after john still 's departure
text: luton town 's search for a new manager is already well under way following john still 's departure from the club yesterday .
the 65-year-old left by mutual consent after taking charge of the hatters in february 2013 and leading them to promotion back to the football league a year later .
on its website , the club writes it is looking for applications for the role from `` serious and high-calibre candidates '' .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m25 to remain closed until this evening
text: i 've just had word from hertfordshire police who 've said the m25 will remain closed clockwise between j20-j21 until about 20:00 .
cleaning is taking place after a collision involving a lorry caused food waste to be strewn across the carriageway .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m25 closed clockwise to clean carriageway
text: the m25 is closed clockwise between j20-j21 due to food waste strewn across the carriageway .
cleaning is taking place and police are advising motorists to avoid the area if possible .
the ambulance service has been called to attend following a collision involving a lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: is the biggest and best tree in the uk in buckinghamshire 's naphill ?
text: people living in a village near high wycombe claim their christmas tree is the best in the country .
residents of naphill have been putting up thousands of lights on the the giant 70ft tree for the past 40 years .
the tree was originally donated by the late bletchley park codebreaker , dilly knox .
now , mike mason , 77 , is in charge of putting the 5,390 led lights on the tree .
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : woman raped in radlett two die in caravan fire
text: the stories we 're looking at this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: andy lee vs billy joe saunders : champion lee aims to show his class
text: andy lee says he will outbox rather than overpower hertfordshire 's billy joe saunders when they meet for the former 's wbo middleweight title on saturday .
ireland 's lee and england 's saunders are both from the irish traveller community , leading many to predict a war at the manchester arena .
author: Ben Dirs
BBC Sport at the O2 in London

documents.title: weather : remaining cloudy but dry
text: it 'll remain cloudy this afternoon , but it should stay dry .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: luton town : supporters ' trust say fans must 'pull together '
text: the chairman of luton town supporters ' trust has said fans must get behind whoever club owners 2020 appoint as manager to replace john still , who left the club by mutual consent yesterday .
tony murray said the news was `` not unexpected but tinged with sadness because of what [ still ] actually did '' in leading the club back into the football league .
he said : `` there 's been a lot of names put forward .
i 'm sure 2020 will make the right decision and bring in the right man and as supporters we just need to get behind them . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m25 clockwise partially blocked in hertfordshire
text: the m25 clockwise is partially blocked before j21 due to a shed load of food waste and a collision between a car transporter and a lorry .
bch road policing

documents.title: woman raped in radlett park last week
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a woman in her 20s was raped in radlett .
hertfordshire police have today released details of the attack , which happened at 02:00 on 26 november in a grass area near to the esso garage in watling street .
officers say the woman had been in the park for a short time before the attack .
they are asking women to remain vigilant , but say no other incidents have been reported .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: how much damage can a deer do ?
text: east herts rural police were called to a report of a car hitting a deer on the a10 between puckeridge and buntingford this morning .
the driver was uninjured , but officers have tweeted to show just how much damage can be caused by such a strike .
luckily the driver is not injured , just some damage to the car .
this photo shows how much damage can be caused
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bedford author richard brittain jailed for 'bad review ' attack
text: a former countdown champion who travelled 400 miles to attack a teenager who gave his book a bad review has been jailed for 30 months by glasgow sheriff court .
richard brittain , 28 , whose address was given as palgrave , bedford , used facebook to track victim paige rolland , 18 , to the asda store in glenrothes where she worked .
he then smashed a full wine bottle over her head - knocking her unconscious .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: morning headlines : fatal caravan fire bedford author jailed
text: the top stories this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton town manager : where are we now ?
text: luton town manager : where are we now ?
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: visitor numbers soar at bletchley park
text: the home of world war two codebreaking centre , , bletchley park , has said it 's had its best year ever , with visitor numbers soaring from 196,000 in 2014 to more than 280,000 this year .
it said the film , the imitation game , inspired cinema goers to discover the story of codebreaking with 80 % of visitors pouring into the mansion 's ballroom to see the sets , costumes and props .
the exhibition has been so popular it has been extended until at least july 2016 .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: caravan fire deaths : investigation into cause ongoing
text: the next of kin of two people who died in a caravan fire in the early hours have been informed , bedfordshire police say .
an investigation into the cause of the fire at kelpie marina along the great north road in roxton is ongoing .
the coroner has also been informed .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two die in bedfordshire caravan fire
text: two people have died in a caravan fire in bedfordshire 's kelpie marina in the early hours of this morning .
bedfordshire fire and rescue were called to the boatyard on the great north road in roxton at 01:00 .
an investigation is under way .
we will bring you more on this story as we get it .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the big picture : bedfordshire 's rushmere country park
text: the main image at the top of our local live page today shows a tranquil scene by the water in rushmere country park in bedfordshire .
thank you to colin phillips from central bedfordshire college for sending us this photograph .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: councils digest government funding agreement
text: councils in beds , herts and bucks are digesting details of the government 's new funding agreement - they 'll get less money next year , but have been promised more over the next four years , plus help to pay for social care .
two councils in our area have increased their spending power - buckinghamshire and hertfordshire - which will gain £ 11m and £ 4m respectively .
the rest are down - in some cases as much as 15 % .
the government says the ability to keep all business rates and raise council tax by up to 4 % will help bridge any funding gaps .
councils say they 're not so sure .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: revellers could be breathalysed in luton and dunstable
text: people going to bars and clubs in luton and dunstable this weekend could be breathalysed before entry if it 's thought they have drunk too much .
bedfordshire police have issued the breathalysers in the hope of easing pressure on emergency services.the roll out begins this evening or `` mad friday '' as the police describe it .
the force says it is illegal to serve alcohol to someone believed to be drunk , so the breathalysers will also help licensees make decisions on who to allow inside .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : dry and mild
text: after a bright start with some sunny spells it will be cloudier this afternoon , but it should stay dry .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: man accused of nicola cross murder due in court
text: a man accused of murdering a woman in hemel hempstead and then trying to kidnap her two young children is due to appear appear at st albans crown court today .
marcin porczynski , 23 , is accused of stabbing nicola cross , 37 , at her home in dunlin road three months ago .
he was arrested by police who were investigating a report of a burglary next door .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bucks council leader says council tax could rise after funding agreement
text: the leader of buckinghamshire county council has said the authority is going to have to consider raising council tax following yesterday 's government funding agreement .
martin tett said : `` all the government assumptions seem to indicate they are assuming year-on-year we put up council tax by 4 % which is something as a conservative i do n't want to have to do .
`` but i think we 've just got ourselves into such a difficult financial situation that 's one of the scenarios we 're really going to have to look at . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : disruption on m25
text: traffic is queuing on the anti-clockwise m25 between j24 for the a111 at potters bar and j23 for the a1 ( m ) due to a broken-down lorry which is now on the hard shoulder .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines : local councils digest funding agreement author who attacked teen over bad review is jailed
text: here are the top stories making the news this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to today 's beds , herts and bucks live page
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for beds , herts and bucks on mad friday - or black friday - depending on which media outlet you are using .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the area from now until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email or tweet us , or get in touch via facebook .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
